result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather L Calkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Heather L Calkins
Current: 28254 County Hwy P, Kendall, WI 54638 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2017)
Prior: 1106 Cty Road J, Neillsville, WI 54456 United States
of 5/9 plea/sentencing hearing notice.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Huff.    Court questioned defendant on her understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  She stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to have a preliminary hearing.

Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 in 15CF101  Defendant plead guilty to Count 2 in 16CF26.  Remaining counts in those cases, plus 15CF120 and 15CF212 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of:  Possession of Meth, contrary to 961.41(3g)(g) and Felony Bail Jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(b).  Joint recommendation for:  probation 4 years.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with Robert Wilkinson,  Jason Brown,  David Barhyte,  or Conner Hansen.  AODA and recommended treatment.  90 days jail, stay all but first 21 days.  73 days credit.  Obtain maintain and maintain employment.  DNA sample.  Comply with trauma care.  

Court ordered: sentence withheld, probation 4 years, concurrent.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  No contact with Robert Wilkinson,  Jason Brown,  David Barhyte,  Conner Hansen, Gage Lewallen or Amy Janicki.    AODA and recommended treatment.  Subject to random drug testing.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  16CF26: 90 days jail, stay all but first 21 days on the condition that the defendant enters into inpatient treatment.  73 days credit if revoked.  Commensurate with treatment needs:  obtain and maintain employment.  Submit DNA sample.  CC.
Information filed with the court.  Reading of the information waived.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Huff.    Court questioned defendant on her understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  She stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to have a preliminary hearing.
Set for plea & sentencing at request of defendant's atty, Charles Huff, via telephone call from his secretary, Jessica.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Huff.  Set for plea/sentencing.  Felony plea.
Status conference at 03-21-2016 03:00 pm

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Niemeier appeared in court.  Defense requesting bond be lowered to $1500.00.   State does not object.  Court granted reduction of bond to $1500.00.

This bond covers:  16CF26, 15CF212, 15CF120, 15CF101.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: C. H., J.B., D.B., G. L. or D. B.
